intro: Paropsia obcuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf lily. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States, typically found in moist, wooded areas. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale pink flowers in late spring. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a flowering stem that bears clusters of bell-shaped blooms. Paropsia obcuneata is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
